entry.title: Release Radar · February 2022 Edition
entry.summary: Our community has shipped lots of open source project updates in the last month. Here's a few of our staff picks.

entry.title: Save time with partial re-runs in GitHub Actions
entry.summary: It is now possible to re-run only failed jobs or a single job in GitHub Actions workflows.

entry.title: Improved management for GitHub Enterprise owners
entry.summary: We've introduced several new features to help enterprise owners more easily manage their accounts, including two features now in public beta.

author.name: Visual Studio Code - Code Editing. Redefined.

entry.title: Visual Studio Code February 2022
entry.summary: Visual Studio Code February 2022 Read the full article

author.name: Visual Studio Code - Code Editing. Redefined.

entry.title: GitHub Availability Report: February 2022
entry.summary: In February, we experienced one incident resulting in significant impact to multiple GitHub services.

entry.title: Our response to the war in Ukraine
entry.summary: As the global response to the tragedies in Ukraine and other impacted regions continues to evolve, I wanted to share with our community an expansion of the message that I shared earlier this week with our Hubbers.

entry.title: A new way to understand your GitHub-hosted runner capacity
entry.summary: Explore and understand your overall GitHub-hosted Actions runner capacity with the new runner view.

entry.title: Codespaces for the largest repositories just got faster
entry.summary: The ability to prebuild codespaces is entering public beta. Enable fast environment creation times, regardless of the size and complexity of your repositories.

entry.title: Get started with ease using security workflows!
entry.summary: GitHub Actions workflows in the Security category will now appear among the workflow recommendations based on a repository's content.

entry.title: GitHub Advisory Database now open to community contributions
entry.summary: Anyone can now provide additional information to further the community’s understanding and awareness of security advisories.
